intro: Cronquistianthus lopez-mirandae, commonly known as the Lopez-Miranda's cronquistianthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Cronquistiaceae family and is characterized by its unique, clustered inflorescences and vibrant, multicolored petals. The plant exhibits a semi-woody stem with smooth, glossy bark and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is typically found in cloud forests at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
